reviews.text: Delightful comfortable bed and breakfast in the heart of Portscatho. Small beach within two minutes walk by the small harbour. Accomodation is stylish with good bathrooms. Courtyard/garden with tables and chairs for guests. Immediately opposite the Plume of Feathers Pub, excellent meals. The walking along the coastal footpath is superb as are the local beaches, our favourite is Porthbeor.

reviews.text: Short drive to St Mawes and ferries to Falmouth, the Helford River, Trellissick Gardens and Truro. Not far from Eden Project and Lost gardens of Heligan.

reviews.title: a great find
reviews.text: The Roseland is a superb part of Cornwall and was relatively quiet even in August.

description: In heart of quiet, pretty, Cornish seaside village. This friendly B&B, recently refurbished to an extremely high standard is stylishly contemporary with light airy bedrooms and public areas. Portscatho is spoilt for quiet sandy beaches, secluded coves, wonderful walks and temperate climate. An ideal base from which to discover the magnificent Roseland, St Mawes, Eden Project, Falmouth and Cornish gardens.
